events.title: Beer Hall Putsch
events.description: Adolf Hitler and the Nazi Party attempt to overthrow the Weimar Republic government in Munich, Germany, but fail and Hitler is arrested.
events.significance: This failed coup marked an early and significant step in Hitler's political career, leading to his imprisonment during which he wrote Mein Kampf, setting the foundations for Nazi ideology.

events.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt Elected President of the United States
events.description: Franklin D. Roosevelt is elected as the 32nd President of the United States, defeating incumbent Herbert Hoover amid the Great Depression.
events.significance: Roosevelt's election led to the New Deal policies that aimed to recover the U.S. economy and reshape American social and political landscapes.

events.title: John F. Kennedy Elected President of the United States
events.description: John F. Kennedy defeats Richard Nixon to become the 35th President of the United States, becoming the youngest elected U.S. president at the time.
events.significance: Kennedyâ€™s presidency included significant events such as the Cuban Missile Crisis and the beginning of the space race; his election symbolized a generational shift in American politics.

events.title: Donald Trump Elected President of the United States
events.description: Businessman and television personality Donald Trump is elected as the 45th President of the United States, defeating Hillary Clinton.
events.significance: Trump's election marked a major shift in American political discourse and policy, characterized by strong populist and nationalist rhetoric.

events.title: George Bernard Shaw's Play 'The Man of Destiny' Premieres
events.description: The Irish playwright George Bernard Shaw premieres his play 'The Man of Destiny' in London, exploring themes of history and leadership.
events.significance: This early work by Shaw contributed to modern drama and theatrical innovation, influencing 20th-century literature and performance arts.
